issue.title: Shaka-player video play add a preflight option request before each Get/Head request
issue.body:
When I play a video in ShakaPlayer it sends a PREFLIGHT request (OPTION) request before *every* fragment fetch which doubles the effort a client should make to play the video.

Do I need to change something in the Shaka configuration?

Here are Header examples:

```
1. 
preflight req.:
  Request URL: https://server/a/b/a/b/first.m3u8?ram=11245
  Request Method: OPTIONS
  Status Code: 200 OK
  Referrer Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin
preflight resp:
  Access-Control-Allow-Headers: speciala, Origin
  Access-Control-Allow-Methods: GET, HEAD
  Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *
  Access-Control-Max-Age: 6000
  Cache-Control: max-age=31536000
  Content-Length: 0
  Content-Length: 0
  Content-Type: text/plain
  Content-Type:  text/plain; charset=utf-8
  Expires: Sat, 26 Oct 2024 08:29:28 GMT

2.
normal req.:
  Request URL:  https://server/a/b/first.m3u8?ram=11245
  Request Method: GET
  Status Code: 200 OK
  Referrer Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin

normal resp:
  Access-Control-Allow-Headers: speciala, Origin
  Access-Control-Allow-Methods: GET, HEAD
  Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *
  Access-Control-Max-Age: 6000
  Cache-Control: max-age=31536000
  Cache-Control: public
  Content-Type: application/vnd.apple.mpegurl
  Expires: Sat, 26 Oct 2024 08:29:28 GMT
  Pragma: public

3. (again before the next normal request we send preflight)
preflight req.:
  Request URL: https://server/a/b/stream_0.m3u8?ram=54d1f
  Request Method: OPTIONS
  Status Code: 200 OK
  Remote Address: 10.0.0.17:443
  Referrer Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin

preflight resp:
  Access-Control-Allow-Headers: speciala, Origin
  Access-Control-Allow-Methods: GET, HEAD
  Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *
  Access-Control-Max-Age: 6000
  Cache-Control: max-age=31536000
  Content-Length: 0
  Content-Length: 0
  Content-Type: text/plain
  Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
  Expires: Sat, 26 Oct 2024 08:29:28 GMT

4. and now a normal response:

normal req.:
  Request URL: https://server/a/b/stream_0.m3u8?ram=54d1f
  Request Method: GET
  Status Code: 200 OK
  Remote Address: 10.0.0.17:443
  Referrer Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin

normal resp:
  Access-Control-Allow-Headers: speciala, Origin
  Access-Control-Allow-Methods: GET, HEAD
  Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *
  Access-Control-Max-Age: 6000
  Cache-Control: max-age=31536000
  Cache-Control: public
  Content-Length: 338
  Content-Type: application/octet-stream
  Content-Type: application/vnd.apple.mpegurl
  Expires: Sat, 26 Oct 2024 08:29:28 GMT
  Pragma: public


```

And this pattern continues for every request the player makes...

comment.body: Sorry, this is not related to Shaka, this is because we have special headers.

issue.title: Shaka-player video play add a preflight option request before each Get/Head request
issue.body:
When I play a video in ShakaPlayer it sends a PREFLIGHT request (OPTION) request before *every* fragment fetch which doubles the effort a client should do to play the video.

I tried to solve it from the server side (by adding the relevant headers), but it didn't solve the issue, I checked another player with another video, and it didn't send those preflight requests so I suspect this is something I need to setup in the shaka configuration?

Here are Header examples:

```
1. 
preflight req.:
  Request URL: https://server/first.m3u8
  Request Method: OPTIONS
  Status Code: 200 OK
  Referrer Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin
preflight resp:
  Access-Control-Allow-Headers: speciala, Origin
  Access-Control-Allow-Methods: GET, HEAD
  Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *
  Access-Control-Max-Age: 6000
  Cache-Control: max-age=31536000
  Content-Length: 0
  Content-Length: 0
  Content-Type: text/plain
  Content-Type:  text/plain; charset=utf-8
  Expires: Sat, 26 Oct 2024 08:29:28 GMT

2.
normal req.:
  Request URL:  https://server/first.m3u8
  Request Method: GET
  Status Code: 200 OK
  Referrer Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin

normal resp:
  Access-Control-Allow-Headers: speciala, Origin
  Access-Control-Allow-Methods: GET, HEAD
  Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *
  Access-Control-Max-Age: 6000
  Cache-Control: max-age=31536000
  Cache-Control: public
  Content-Type: application/vnd.apple.mpegurl
  Expires: Sat, 26 Oct 2024 08:29:28 GMT
  Pragma: public

3. (again before the next normal request we send preflight)
preflight req.:
  Request URL: https://server/stream_0.m3u8
  Request Method: OPTIONS
  Status Code: 200 OK
  Remote Address: 10.0.0.17:443
  Referrer Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin

preflight resp:
  Access-Control-Allow-Headers: speciala, Origin
  Access-Control-Allow-Methods: GET, HEAD
  Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *
  Access-Control-Max-Age: 6000
  Cache-Control: max-age=31536000
  Content-Length: 0
  Content-Length: 0
  Content-Type: text/plain
  Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
  Expires: Sat, 26 Oct 2024 08:29:28 GMT

4. and now a normal response:

normal req.:
  Request URL: https://server/stream_0.m3u8
  Request Method: GET
  Status Code: 200 OK
  Remote Address: 10.0.0.17:443
  Referrer Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin

normal resp:
  Access-Control-Allow-Headers: speciala, Origin
  Access-Control-Allow-Methods: GET, HEAD
  Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *
  Access-Control-Max-Age: 6000
  Cache-Control: max-age=31536000
  Cache-Control: public
  Content-Length: 338
  Content-Type: application/octet-stream
  Content-Type: application/vnd.apple.mpegurl
  Expires: Sat, 26 Oct 2024 08:29:28 GMT
  Pragma: public

```

And this pattern continue for every request the player make...

issue.title: feat: Improve latency in LL DASH streams
issue.body: This change causes the prefetch to be called much earlier, which improves latency in DASH streams in around 500ms.

improves latency in DASH streams in around 500ms.

issue.title: Question/Future request: ShakaPlayer audio and subtitle track detection (audioDescription, original, sdh)

labels.name: component: HLS
labels.description: The issue involves Apple's HLS manifest format

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Features for an unspecified release in the future.

issue.body:
**Have you read the [FAQ](https://bit.ly/ShakaFAQ) and checked for duplicate open issues?**
I did.

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. Ex. I'm always frustrated when [...] -->
At the beginning, I would like to point out that I am using ShakaPlayer in Chromecast CAF.
I would like to inquire about the technical capabilities of ShakaPlayer for detecting the following audio/subtitle tracks roles in a manifest.
* **Audio description** (audio description for the visually impaired),
* Audio **Original Version**, (source audio version)
* Subtitle **Hearing impaired** (sdh: subtitling for the deaf and hard of hearing)

**Describe the solution you'd like**
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you want to happen. -->
To extend the audio/subtitle ShakaPlayer API in order to obtain information about the above values.

I don't know what it looks like in DASH, but in HLS everything is available in the CHARACTERISTICS attribute in the manifest.
audio description: `CHARACTERISTICS="public.accessibility.describes-video"`
hearing impaired: `CHARACTERISTICS="public.accessibility.transcribes-spoken-dialog,public.accessibility.describes-music-and-sound"`
original language: `CHARACTERISTICS="public.original-content"`

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
<!-- A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered. -->
No alternatives.

**Additional context**
<!-- Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here. -->
In our application, we need to add a detailed description and specify the mentioned types above and I would like to know if it is technically possible using ShakaPlayer.

comment.body:
I created https://github.com/shaka-project/shaka-player/pull/5819 for "Subtitle "Hearing impaired""

I have not been able to find the public.original-content in the HLS spec (https://developer.apple.com/streaming/HLS-draft-pantos.pdf) so we cannot accept this change. Regarding the change of "Audio description" I would like to know @theodab's opinion

milestone.title: Backlog

issue.body:
**Have you read the [FAQ](https://bit.ly/ShakaFAQ) and checked for duplicate open issues?**
I did.

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. Ex. I'm always frustrated when [...] -->
At the beginning, I would like to point out that I am using ShakaPlayer in Chromecast CAF.
I would like to inquire about the technical capabilities of ShakaPlayer for detecting the following audio/subtitle tracks roles in a manifest.
* **Audio description** (audio description for the visually impaired),
* Audio **Original Version**, (source audio version)
* Subtitle **Hearing impaired** (sdh: subtitling for the deaf and hard of hearing)

**Describe the solution you'd like**
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you want to happen. -->
To extend the audio/subtitle ShakaPlayer API in order to obtain information about the above values.

I don't know what it looks like in DASH, but in HLS everything is available in the CHARACTERISTICS attribute in the manifest.
audio description: `CHARACTERISTICS="public.accessibility.describes-video"`
hearing impaired: `CHARACTERISTICS="public.accessibility.transcribes-spoken-dialog,public.accessibility.describes-music-and-sound"`
original language: `CHARACTERISTICS="public.original-content"`

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
<!-- A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered. -->
No alternatives.

**Additional context**
<!-- Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here. -->
In our application, we need to add a detailed description and specify the mentioned types above and I would like to know if it is technically possible using ShakaPlayer.

comment.body: Probably it is, sorry if my question wasn't clear. I'm using CAF that have their unusual implementation of ShakaPlayer API. To sum up i'm asking whether shaka player technically detects the above roles (HLS was just an example).

issue.title: Does shaka support srt subtitles

  This template is for questions.
  If you suspect that your issue might be a bug, but aren't sure, please file the bug template instead.
  If you want to know whether we will support a feature, please file the feature request template instead.
